attributes.action: recognise, in law, rights, appropriate to the interests of non-human animals. Furthermore, to prohibit the rights of non-human animals being violated.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently non-human animals have no legally recognised rights and can be considered property. 
While there are many great differences between species, both human and non-human animals can feel pain and suffer, so have an interest in the avoidance of the aforementioned. It is not acceptable to withhold rights from beings on the basis of species membership. Intelligence level or the inability to reciprocate rights is not a valid reason for withholding rights from any individual with interests. Indeed, we would not allow such measures to be used in deciding who has rights within our own species.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "recognise, in law, rights, appropriate to the interests of non-human animals. Furthermore, to prohibit the rights of non-human animals being violated."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15544.asp

Prime Minister's Office
